content: Under the Enhanced Medical Benefits for COVID-19, Overseas Medical Expenses for an Adult (age above 70 years) are not available for the Basic plan, but are covered up to $25,000 for the Silver plan, $75,000 for the Gold plan, and $150,000 for the Platinium plan.
questions: What are the coverage limits for overseas medical expenses for adults over 70 under different plans?
Is there any coverage for overseas medical expenses for adults above 70 in the Basic plan?
How much does the Silver plan cover for overseas medical expenses for adults over 70?
What is the maximum coverage provided under the Gold plan for overseas medical expenses for adults above 70?
Can adults over 70 get up to $150,000 coverage for overseas medical expenses under any plan?
What are the differences in overseas medical expense coverage between the Silver, Gold, and Platinium plans for adults over 70?
Are there any plans that offer no coverage for overseas medical expenses for adults above 70?
What is the highest amount of coverage available for overseas medical expenses for adults over 70?
How does the coverage for overseas medical expenses increase from the Silver plan to the Platinium plan for adults over 70?
Which plan should an adult over 70 choose to get the maximum coverage for overseas medical expenses?
